channel.title: Compares on Syntax Compare

item.title: 1.1. coding convention
item.description: • Effective Dart: Style

item.title: 5.1. string template
item.description:
>>> import math
>>> print(f'The value of pi is approximately {math.pi:.3f}.')
The value of pi is approximately 3.142.

Reference

  • https://mechurak.github.io/ko/posts/python/2020-11-29_f-string/
  • https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/inputoutput.html#formatted-string-literals

item.title: 9.3. log
item.description:
ArenaBattle.h

#include "EngineMinimal.h"

DECLARE_LOG_CATEGORY_EXTERN(ArenaBattle, Log, All);  // 로그 태그

#define ABLOG_CALLINFO (FString(__FUNCTION__) + TEXT("(") + FString::FromInt(__LINE__) + TEXT(")"))
#define ABLOG_S(Verbosity) UE_LOG(ArenaBattle, Verbosity, TEXT("%s"), *ABLOG_CALLINFO)
#define ABLOG(Verbosity, Format, ...) UE_LOG(ArenaBattle, Verbosity, TEXT("%s %s"), *ABLOG_CALLINFO, *FString::Printf(Format, ##__VA_ARGS__))

ArenaBattle.cpp

DEFINE_LOG_CATEGORY(ArenaBattle);  // 로그 태그
IMPLEMENT_PRIMARY_GAME_MODULE( FDefaultGameModuleImpl, ArenaBattle, "ArenaBattle" );

Usage

// 헤더 파일에서 대표 헤더 포함
#include "ArenaBattle.h"

// 사용처
UE_LOG(ArenaBattle, Warning, TEXT("Actor Name : %s, ID: %d, Location X: %.3f"), *GetName(), ID, GetActorLocation().X);
ABLOG_S(Warning);
ABLOG(Warning, TEXT("Actor Name : %s, ID: %d, Location X: %.3f"), *GetName(), ID, GetActorLocation().X);

출력

ArenaBattle: Warning: Actor Name : Fountain_1, ID: 0, Location X: 0.000
ArenaBattle: Warning: AFountain::BeginPlay(51)
ArenaBattle: Warning: AFountain::BeginPlay(52) Actor Name : Fountain_1, ID: 0, Location X: 0.000

item.title: 1.1. coding convention
item.description: • Coding Standard

item.title: 6.2. constructor
item.description:
UCLASS()
class ARENABATTLE_API AFountain : public AActor
{
	GENERATED_BODY()

    // ..

	UPROPERTY(VisibleAnywhere)
	UStaticMeshComponent* Body;

	UPROPERTY(VisibleAnywhere)
	UStaticMeshComponent* Water;
};

.

AFountain::AFountain()
{
	Body = CreateDefaultSubobject<UStaticMeshComponent>(TEXT("BODY"));
	Water = CreateDefaultSubobject<UStaticMeshComponent>(TEXT("WATER"));

	RootComponent = Body;
	Water->SetupAttachment(Body);
	Water->SetRelativeLocation(FVector(0.0f, 0.0f, 135.0f));

	static ConstructorHelpers::FObjectFinder<UStaticMesh> SM_BODY(TEXT("StaticMesh'/Game/InfinityBladeGrassLands/Environments/Plains/Env_Plains_Ruins/StaticMesh/SM_Plains_Castle_Fountain_01.SM_Plains_Castle_Fountain_01'"));
	if (SM_BODY.Succeeded())
	{
		Body->SetStaticMesh(SM_BODY.Object);
	}
    static ConstructorHelpers::FObjectFinder<UStaticMesh> SM_WATER(TEXT("StaticMesh'/Game/InfinityBladeGrassLands/Effects/FX_Meshes/Env/SM_Plains_Fountain_02.SM_Plains_Fountain_02'"));
	if (SM_WATER.Succeeded())
	{
		Water->SetStaticMesh(SM_WATER.Object);
	}

item.title: 9.2. ternary operator
item.description:
val a = 10
val b = 20

val max = if (a > b) a else b  // If expression
println(max)

20
  • if가 expression 이라서, 따로 3항 연산자 없음

Reference

  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/control-flow.html

item.title: 4.4. utility
item.description:
val numbers = listOf("one", "two", "three", "four", "five")
val grouped = numbers.groupBy { number -> number[0] }  // 첫 글자로 그룹핑
println(grouped)

{o=[one], t=[two, three], f=[four, five]}

Reference

  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/collection-grouping.html

item.title: 3.2. for-loop (with index)
item.description:
val fruits = listOf("apple", "banana", "mango")

// option 1
for (i in fruits.indices) {
    println("$i: ${fruits[i]}")
}

// option 2
for ((i, fruit) in fruits.withIndex()) {
    println("$i: $fruit")
}

// option 3
fruits.forEachIndexed { i, fruit ->
    println("$i: $fruit")
}

// option 4 (for specific range)
for (i in 0..2) {  // [0, 2]
    println("$i: ${fruits[i]}")
}

0: apple
1: banana
2: mango

Reference

  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/control-flow.html#for-loops

item.title: 3.1. for-loop (collection)
item.description:
val fruits = listOf("apple", "banana", "mango")

// option 1
for (fruit in fruits) {
    println(fruit)
}

// option 2
fruits.forEach { fruit ->
    println(fruit)
}

apple
banana
mango

Reference

  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/iterators.html
  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/control-flow.html#for-loops

item.title: 1.1. coding convention
item.description:
• Airbnb JavaScript Style Guide

item.title: 1.2. types
item.description:
print type

  const fruits = ["apple", "banana", "mango"];
  console.log(typeof fruits);

> "object"

Reference

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/typeof

item.title: 3.1. for-loop (collection)
item.description:
const fruits = ["apple", "banana", "mango"];

// option 1 (for...of)
for (const fruit of fruits) {
  console.log(fruit);
}

// option 2 (forEach)
fruits.forEach((fruit) => console.log(fruit));

> "apple"
> "banana"
> "mango"

Reference

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/for...of
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/forEach

item.title: 4.4. utility
item.description:
filter

const fruits = ["apple", "banana", "mango"];
const result = fruits.filter((fruit) => fruit.length > 5);
console.log(result);

> Array ["banana"]

Reference

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/filter

groupby

const numbers = ["one", "two", "three", "four", "five"];
const grouped = numbers.reduce((acc, value) => {
  if (!acc[value[0]]) {
    acc[value[0]] = [];
  }
  acc[value[0]].push(value);
  return acc;
}, {});

console.log(grouped);

> Object { o: Array ["one"], t: Array ["two", "three"], f: Array ["four", "five"] }

Reference

  • https://www.robinwieruch.de/javascript-groupby

item.title: 5.1. string template
item.description:
const fruit = "apple";
const sentence = `My daughter likes ${fruit}.`; // Use backtick(`)
console.log(sentence);

> "My daughter likes apple."

Template literals (Template strings)

Reference

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Template_literals

item.title: 5.2. split
item.description:
const multiLineText = `apple
banana
mango`;

  const fruits = multiLineText.split("\n");
  console.log(fruits);

> Array ["apple", "banana", "mango"]

Reference

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/split

item.title: 1.2. types
item.description:
basic types

Reference

  • https://kotlinlang.org/docs/basic-types.html

type checks and cast

print type

val fruits = listOf("apple", "banana", "mango")
println(fruits::class.simpleName)

Reference

item.title: 3.2. for-loop (with index)
item.description:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "mango"]
for i, fruit in enumerate(fruits):
    print(f"{i}: {fruit}")

0: apple
1: banana
2: mango

item.title: 3.1. for-loop (collection)
item.description:
fruits = ["apple", "banana", "mango"]
for fruit in fruits:
    print(fruit)

apple
banana
mango
